data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Install the package.xml for use by overlay workspaces (#6)

We need the package.xml to be present in the install space so that we can use rosdep to install the `tinyxml2` key. This is particularly important when we're leveraging a subset of the distributed "fat" archive.

data.author: Steven! Ragnarök
data.message:
Merge pull request #5 from ros2/cmake-variables

Remove undesired reset of TinyXML2_FOUND and update TODO

data.author: Steven! Ragnarök
data.message:
Update TODO comment.

Did some brushing up on [the docs] and find_package_handle_standard_args
make any alterations to the variables passed in. All it does is set
PackageName_FOUND and PACKAGENAME_FOUND if those variables all contain
valid results. So setting the mixed case variables is still required if
those are what downstream intends to consume.

[the docs]: https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/module/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.html

data.author: Steven! Ragnarök
data.message:
FOUND variable already set with proper casing.

This line was introduced as part of 2a1ed4b and was probably added for
reasons related to the issue resolved by 460faf8. However, the result
of merging these two PRs is that after successfully finding TinyXML2 and
setting both TinyXML2_FOUND and TINYXML2_FOUND (per the documentation in
find_package_handle_standard_args) we are then re-setting TinyXML2_FOUND
to the value of a now-unused variable: tinyxml2_FOUND resulting in it
being unset/empty again after being found.

The all-lower-case tinyxml2_FOUND / find_package(tinyxml2) is not used
within the ROS 2 sources (nor should it be).

data.author: Jacob Perron

data.author: Michael Carroll
data.message:
Change case of find_package_handle_standard_args (#3)

* Set FOUND_VAR on both logic paths.

This is needed for ament_target_dependencies to properly work.

* Mixed-case find_package_handle_standard_args.
